UG White Brand Guide Logos Color Apparel Graphics
 

UG White Brand Guide

All source files for the brand guide can be found in the UG White Assets Dropbox folder.

Last updated July 19, 2015

Logos

The UG White color "diamond" logo is the primary logo for the brand. In situations where monochrome (such as 2-color print) is the only option, a black and white adjusted version of the logo is provided.

Logos should never be reduced to less than 2 inches in width.

"Diamond" Logo

Color

Black & White

Tri-color and duo-color versions of the logo are ready for placement on primary brand colors.

Tri-color

Forest

Rust

Duo-color

Forest

Rust

UG White outposts have their own variation of the primary logo. Each outpost has it's own numeric identifier in the logo.

Outpost Logo

UG White Apparel has a distinct logo that is used in designs and collar tags.

See the Apparel section for more information.

Apparel Logo

Colors

The UG White brand has three primary colors: Forest, Rust, and Sand.

The UG White "diamond" color logo may only be presented in the primary brand colors.

Primary Colors

 

Forest

RGB: 74 118 40
CMYK: 73 33 100 19
Hex: 4A7628

 

Rust

RGB: 184 61 36
CMYK: 0 48 58 28
Hex: B83D24

 

Sand

RGB: 243 228 178
CMYK: 5 7 35 0
Hex: F3E4B2

Secondary colors are used as a companion palette to the primary colors. These colors appear on apparel and other brand assets.

Secondary Colors

 

Sunbeam

RGB: 246 178 33
CMYK: 0 28 87 4
Hex: F6B221

 

Honeycomb

RGB: 217 154 41
CMYK: 0 29 81 15
Hex: D99A29

 

Cardinal

RGB: 191 30 46
CMYK: 0 63 57 25
Hex: BF1E2E

 

Dusk

RGB: 122 35 46
CMYK: 0 71 62 52
Hex: 7A232E

 

Clay

RGB: 112 98 89
CMYK: 0 13 21 56
Hex: 706259

 

Mossy Oak

RGB: 79 74 51
CMYK: 0 6 35 69
Hex: 4F4A33

 

Bark

RGB: 81 54 40
CMYK: 0 33 51 68
Hex: 513628

 

Full Moon

RGB: 0 43 73
CMYK: 100 41 0 71
Hex: 002B49

Apparel

UG White apparel use "badges" that contain iconic imagery. Each image has been selected and designed to express the ideals of UG White and its merchandise.

Badges can be presented in any combination of the brand's primary or secondary colors.

Mark

Outline

Filled
